page.title: 04LAYER_DE_LA_HAYE
page.content: At the beginning of the fifteenth century the family of Tey were Lords of the Manor of Layer_de_la_Haye and of some neighbouring parishes.Their Manor House stood on the site of the present Layer Hall Farm.By the eighteenth century the manor had passed to a Colonel John Brown who served as Cornet of Horse in the armies of John, Duke of Marlborough.He died as a Lieutenant_General in France but is buried under a magnificent obelisk in the churchhyard.In his will he left Â£100 to the poor of the parish.
